title: Worcester now prohibits ICE action on city property. Is Boston next?
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Worcester prohibits ICE from using municipal properties for federal civil immigration enforcement operations.
The amendment follows high-profile incidents involving ICE, including fatal shootings in Minneapolis.
Similar restrictions have been implemented in cities like Providence, Rhode Island, and at the state level in Massachusetts.

title: Jeffrey Epstein wanted Robert Kraft to hire his lawyer amid Patriots owner’s prostitution case, documents show
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jeffrey Epstein encouraged Robert Kraft to hire his lawyer, Jack Goldberger, during Kraft's 2019 prostitution case.
Emails released by the Justice Department show Epstein suggesting legal assistance to Kraft shortly after Kraft's charges.
Kraft hired Goldberger, and the misdemeanor prostitution charge was dropped in September 2020.

title: Porter Airlines is increasing service between Boston and Canada
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Porter Airlines will launch two new high-frequency routes from Boston to Montréal and Toronto on May 14, 2026.
Flights will operate from Logan Airport to Montréal–Trudeau seven times weekly and Toronto Pearson 14 times weekly.
Porter Airlines' network is expanding by 20%, the fastest growth among North American airlines, according to their VP.

title: Healey signs collaboration agreement with Denmark amid Greenland tensions
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey signed a collaboration agreement with Denmark to boost research, innovation, and business ties with Massachusetts.
The agreement comes amid U.S.-Denmark tensions over President Trump's proposal for American control of Greenland.
Denmark is a key economic partner for Massachusetts, generating approximately $250 million in annual trade with the state.

title: Traveling to Super Bowl LX? Here’s what to see and do in Santa Clara.
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Santa Clara offers free attractions like the 52-acre Central Park and the Intel Museum for Super Bowl visitors.
Levi's Stadium hosts Super Bowl LX, featuring the Patriots vs. Seahawks, located near Santa Clara's diverse culinary scene.
California's Great America amusement park features Gold Striker, a top West Coast wooden rollercoaster, for thrill seekers.

title: What Boston looked like in 2019 when the Patriots last won the Super Bowl
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: New England Patriots won their sixth Super Bowl on February 3, 2019, defeating the Los Angeles Rams 13-3.
In early 2019, Encore Boston Harbor was still under construction, officially opening in June.
Elizabeth Warren announced her presidential run in Lawrence, Massachusetts on February 9, 2019.

title: Officer and civilian shot, suspect killed in Spencer
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A suspect identified as Patrick Madison shot a person on Main Street in Spencer and fled the scene.
Madison barricaded himself in a Family Dollar bathroom, leading to a gunfire exchange with police, resulting in his death.
A Millbury police officer and the initial shooting victim were injured and received medical treatment; both are in stable condition.

title: Cape Cod house with Watergate ties falls victim to eroding bluff
author: Regina Cole
bullets: Demolition started on Bartlett House in Eastham, Massachusetts, due to bluff erosion threatening the structure's stability.
The Bartlett House served as a retreat for Nixon-era government figures and is linked to the Watergate scandal.
Apex Abatement and Demolition found no hazardous materials, with demolition expected to take about a week.

title: UMass Lowell wants to make the city a destination with a new rink and hotel
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: UMass Lowell plans a new ice rink and hotel to attract students, residents, and visitors to downtown Lowell.
The projects are part of the Lowell Innovation Network Corridor to increase the Tsongas Center's capacity for events.
UMass Lowell collaborates with industry partners, driving economic growth through public-private partnerships like those with Raytheon and others.

title: Judge drops assault charge against former City Hall staffer
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Judge dropped assault charge against ex-City Hall staffer Chulan Huang after the victim did not appear in court.
Huang's legal issues stemmed from a domestic incident involving Marwa Khudaynazar and allegations against city official Segun Idowu.
Khudaynazar's lawsuit claims she was fired to protect Idowu; a judge dismissed most claims but allowed First Amendment claim to proceed.
